content.description:
Sit start.   Move up the wall on improving holds after the tricky start.   Continue to the rounded break.

Take a breath and down-climb the problem to finish.

This problem isn't listed in the Bishop Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Right side of cliff, right of the layaway crack

content.description:
Start up the pocketed wall from a standing start.   Climb the the wall directly on improving holds and rock.

Once at the break take a breath and down-climb the problem to finish.

This problem isn't listed in the Bishop Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.

Start up the white face of small crimps and gain the break above - good footwork helps.

Pass the break and continue on improving holds to the top.
content.location: Middle of the white face on the left of the cliff

content.description:
Sit start.   Climb directly up the pocketed wall to the break a few feet below the top.

Continue through the break to gain good holds over the top and the finish.

High with a less then perfect landing - take care.

This problem isn't listed in the Bishop Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Far right end of the cliff

content.description:
Climb the obvious layaway crack to the large break at 3/4 height.   Once at the break take a breath and down-climb to finish.

This problem isn't listed in the Bishop Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.

Start up the right side of the prow with a long reach.   The block and crack on the right is off.

Continue up the steep prow above with difficulty until a long reach gains hidden holds on the slab above.

Remain composed and push on through to the slab above.
content.location: Right side of the central prow

content.description: Start up the left side of the arete with some difficult pulls on small sharp pockets and terrible feet.   Gain better pockets up and left then lean out to the arete to an exciting finish.
content.location: Left side of the central prow
